title: In Germany, economic decline is looming
summary: Germany, the driving force behind Europe, is currently experiencing severe economic and political turbulence, enough to rekindle deep-seated identity anxieties.

title: Syrian rebels take control of most of Aleppo, as Russian air strikes reported
summary: Russian air strikes were reported in Syria's second city for the first time since 2016 as rebel fighters took control of the city's airport as part of their lightning attack.

title: Trump taps Charles Kushner, his son-in-law's father, as envoy to France and Kash Patel as FBI head
summary: The multimillionaire real estate executive, 70, once served jail time in federal prison after pleading guilty in 2004 to 18 counts of tax evasion, witness tampering and making illegal campaign contributions. Trump also turned to fierce loyalist Patel to upend the top US law enforcement agency.

title: Syria at the center of Israel's strategy to prevent Hezbollah from rebuilding its arsenal
summary: For the past two months, Israel has been bombing its neighbor in order to prevent the Shiite party from transporting weapons and reinforcements to its Lebanese strongholds.

title: 'Hiding Saddam Hussein,' by Halkawt Mustafa: Testimony from  the farmer who hid the Iraqi dictator
summary: This documentary recounts the extraordinary story of Alaa Namiq, a kindly farmer who met and sheltered the former president of the Iraqi Republic for eight months in 2003.

title: Paris dreams of becoming the capital of positive AI with the organization of an international summit in February 2025
summary: France will host 100 heads of state and some 600 business and NGO leaders from the USA and Europe, as well as China and Africa.

title: Thousands gather in Georgia's capital Tbilisi during third night of pro-EU protests
summary: Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze's statement that Georgia will not seek to open accession talks with the European Union until 2028 ignited a furious reaction from the opposition and three days of protests, with over 100 people arrested.

title: Trump calls meeting with Canadian PM Trudeau 'productive' after tariff threat
summary: A smiling Trudeau was seen exiting a hotel in West Palm Beach before arriving at Mar-a-Lago, making him the latest high-profile guest of Trump, whose impending second term  is already overshadowing the last few months of Biden's administration. Trudeau told journalists that they had an 'excellent conversation,' but did not elaborate

title: World Central Kitchen 'pauses operations in Gaza' after Israeli strike
summary: The Israeli military confirmed that a Palestinian employee of  World Central Kitchen was killed Saturday after Gaza rescuers announced the deaths of three aid workers following an Israeli air strike.

title: In Kyrgyzstan, power oppresses rhyme
summary: Highly popular in this Central Asian country, traditional poets, or akyns, are in turn subject to the censorship and repression that President Sadyr Japarov's authoritarian regime has imposed on civil society since 2021.

title: Macron's 'successful gamble' with Notre-Dame
summary: On Friday, the French president attempted to turn the cathedral's timely restoration into a 'metaphor for the life of the nation.'

title: Spanish floods reveal an overlooked issue: The impact of climate disasters on working life
summary: While heatwaves are beginning to be considered, other impacts, such as flooding, are not looked at from a business perspective. Teleworking is a useful tool in response to these uncertainties.

title: French budget: S&P encourages  Barnier to stick with his austerity plan
summary: On Friday, the world's leading credit rating agency kept France's credit rating unchanged, but expressed concern about the 'considerable risk' that the government's planned cost-cutting measures will not materialize.

title: Young adults' contradictory relationship with money
summary: The financial behaviors of young people stand out in numerous ways and confuse many with their paradoxes, shaped by the challenges of the times.

title: From Paris to Los Angeles, the dream life of pianist prodigy Sofiane Pamart
summary: The French artist from Lille who's now based in Los Angeles, played at the opening ceremonies of the Paris Olympics and the Césars movie awards.

title: Suspects arrested after Kosovo canal blast labeled a 'terrorist attack' by PM
summary: The blast occurred on Friday near the town of Zubin Potok in the country's troubled north, damaging a canal supplying water to cooling systems at two power plants that generate most of Kosovo's electricity.

title: French army's forced retreat from Africa continues
summary: Chad's announcement that it is breaking off its defense agreement with Paris, followed by Senegal's declaration that it plans to send French soldiers home, indicate France's failure to redefine the former colonial power's military posture on the continent.

title: Brazil's restoration of the 'Atlantic Forest' is beginning to bear fruit
summary: The rainforest that once covered around 15% of Brazil has shrunk by more than three-quarters. However, initiatives are multiplying, notably to reforest Rio de Janeiro.

title: Russian missile strike on central Ukraine kills 4, wounds at least 21
summary: The hit comes after a massive aerial attack on Ukraine's energy sector, which it called a response to Ukraine firing US and British-supplied missiles on Russian territory.

title: Lightning rebel offensive in Syria's Aleppo, in a Middle East in full reconstruction
summary: A coalition of groups hostile to Bashar al-Assad's regime, dominated by the radical Islamists of Hayʼat Tahrir al-Sham, has seized most of the major northern city. This breakthrough was facilitated by the weakening of the pro-Iranian camp, thanks to the war in Lebanon.

title: Jérôme Bimbenet, biographer: 'Leni Riefenstahl aestheticized the violence of the Third Reich'
summary: Historian Jérôme Bimbenet discusses the paradoxes of the German director, who is the subject of a new documentary  'Riefenstahl' by Andres Veiel.

title: China 'strongly condemns' US for Taiwan President's Hawaii visit
summary: Lai Ching-te was given a red carpet welcome upon arrival in Honolulu on Saturday. China claims Taiwan as part of its territory and has responded to Lai's first overseas trip as president with threats to 'resolutely crush' any attempt for independence.

title: In Romania, 'no one knew anything' about Calin Georgescu, who won first round of presidential elections
summary: Draganesti, adorned with European flags and a stronghold of the Social Democratic Party, cast 37% of its votes on Sunday for the pro-Russian far-right candidate Calin Georgescu in the first round of the presidential election. On December 8, this outsider will face the pro-European centrist Elena Lasconi in the runoff.

title: EU's new foreign policy chief warns Georgia over violence against protesters
summary: 'It is clear that using violence against peaceful protesters is not acceptable, and the Georgian government should respect the will of the Georgian people,' Kaja Kallas told journalists on Sunday.

title: 'Exhausted,' Léon Marchand withdraws from Budapest world championships
summary: The four-time Olympic champion was originally due to compete in the December World Championships in the 25-meter pool. Describing himself as 'exhausted,' the French swimmer has decided not to take part.

title: With the appointment of Yechiel Leiter, Netanyahu places one of his men next to Trump
summary: The Israeli prime minister wasted no time in appointing an ambassador to Washington who has a radical right-wing profile and is based in a West Bank settlement.

title: UNRWA halts aid delivery via key Gaza-Israel crossing
summary: In a post on X on Sunday, the UNRWA chief listed how the humanitarian operation had become 'unnecessarily impossible' due to 'the ongoing siege, hurdles from Israeli authorities, political decisions to restrict the amounts of aid, lack of safety on aid routes and targeting of local police.'

title: Why Denmark is embarrassed by the Paul Watson affair
summary: On Monday, a Greenland court is due to rule for the sixth time on the prolonged pre-trial detention of the whale defender, arrested over five months ago. Denmark has been slow to respond to Japan's extradition request.
